Frame module

class Frame.Frame(type_frame: str = 'Frame')[source]

Bases: object

Class represents a frame.

Attributes: _id (int): Unique identifier for each instance of the class. _instances (list): List of all instances of the class. _start_byte (int): Start byte value.

Methods: __init__(self, type_frame: str = ‘Frame’): Constructor method. is_structured(self) -> bool: Checks if the frame is structured. serialize(self) -> Any: Serializes the frame data. get_length_of_data(self) -> int: Returns the length of the frame data.

is_structured() → bool[source]

Checks if the frame is structured.

Returns: bool: True if the frame is structured, False otherwise.

property id: int

Returns the unique identifier of the frame.

Returns: int: Unique identifier of the frame.

property type_in_word: str

Returns the type of the frame.

Returns: str: Type of the frame.

classmethod get_all_instances() → list[source]

Returns all instances of the Frame class.

Returns: list: List of all instances of the Frame class.

serialize() → Any[source]

Serializes the frame data.

Returns: Any: Serialized frame data.

property length: int

Returns the total length of the frame.

Returns: int: Total length of the frame.

get_length_of_data() → int[source]

Returns the length of the frame data.

Returns: int: Length of the frame data.

property structure: bytes

Returns the structure of the frame.

Returns: bytes: Structure of the frame.

classmethod start_byte() → int[source]

Returns the start byte value.

Returns: int: Start byte value.
